intro: Draba columbiana, commonly known as the Columbia draba, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often at high elevations. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, and its leaves are basal, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Draba columbiana is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in mountainous regions.
